author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Creates a public key (.cer file), a private key (.pfx) file, and a Base64 encoded private key to use to authenticate the EWS Extension Online Powershell v2 integration.
automation.name: CreateCertificate

automation.description: Get emails from multiple folders of an account all at once.
automation.name: GetEWSFolder

commands.description: Expands a distribution list to display all members. By default, expands only first layer of the distribution list. If recursive-expansion is "True", the command expands nested distribution lists and returns all members.
commands.name: ews-expand-group

commands.description: Retrieves items by item ID.
commands.name: ews-get-items

commands.description: Move an item to different folder in the mailbox.
commands.name: ews-move-item

commands.description: Sends an email.
commands.name: send-mail

commands.description: Retrieves information for folders for a specified mailbox. Only folders with read permissions will be returned. Your visual folders on the mailbox, such as "Inbox", are under the folder "Top of Information Store".
commands.name: ews-find-folders

commands.description: Delete items from mailbox.
commands.name: ews-delete-items

commands.description: Run this command if for some reason you need to rerun the authentication process.
commands.name: ews-auth-reset

commands.description: Retrieves contacts for a specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-get-contacts

commands.description: Returns a list of searchable mailboxes. This command requires eDiscovery permissions to the Exchange Server. For more information, see the EWSv2 integration documentation.
commands.name: ews-get-searchable-mailboxes

commands.description: Moves an item from one mailbox to different mailbox.
commands.name: ews-move-item-between-mailboxes

commands.description: Retrieves items from a specified folder in a mailbox. The items are order by the item created time, most recent is first.
commands.name: ews-get-items-from-folder

commands.description: Deletes the attachments of an item (email message).
commands.name: ews-delete-attachment

commands.description: Retrieves a single folder.
commands.name: ews-get-folder

commands.description: Replies to an email using EWS.
commands.name: reply-mail

commands.description: Creates a new folder in a specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-create-folder

commands.description: Retrieves the actual attachments from an item (email message). To get all attachments for a message, only specify the item-id argument.
commands.name: ews-get-attachment

commands.description: Marks items as read or unread.
commands.name: ews-mark-items-as-read

commands.description: Recovers messages that were soft-deleted.
commands.name: ews-recover-messages

commands.description: Marks an item as junk. This is commonly used to block an email address. For more information, see the Microsoft documentation: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn481311(v=exchg.150).aspx.
commands.name: ews-mark-item-as-junk

commands.description: Retrieves the out-of-office status for a specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-get-out-of-office

commands.description: Retrieves items by item ID and uploads its content as an EML file.
commands.name: ews-get-items-as-eml

commands.description: Searches for items in the specified mailbox. Specific permissions are needed for this operation to search in a target mailbox other than the default.
commands.name: ews-search-mailbox

commands.description:
Searches message data for the last 10 days. If you run this command without any arguments, only data from the last 48 hours is returned.
If you enter a start date that is older than 10 days, you will receive an error and the command will return no results.
This command returns a maximum of 1,000,000 results, and will timeout on very large queries. If your query returns too many results, consider splitting it up using shorter start_date and end_date intervals.
commands.name: ews-message-trace-get

integration.description: Deprecated. Use ***EWS Extension Online Powershell v3*** instead.
integration.name: O365 - EWS - Extension (Deprecated)

playbook.description:
This playbook performs the following steps:
1. Creates a compliance search.
2. Starts a compliance search.
3. Waits for the compliance search to complete.
4. Gets the results of the compliance search.
5. Gets the preview results, if specified.
6. Deletes the search results (Hard/Soft).
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search And Delete

playbook.description: Get emails from specific folders and pre-process them using EWS.
playbook.name: Get Mails By Folder Paths

playbook.description:
This playbook performs the following steps:
1. Creates a new compliance search action Purge - Hard or Soft.
2. Waits for the compliance search action to complete.
3. Retrieves the delete search action.
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search Action - Delete

playbook.description:
This playbook perform:
1. Creates a new compliance search action - Preview (Base on created compliance search).
2. Waits for the preview action to complete.
3. Retrieves the preview results.
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search Action - Preview

playbook.description: Run a ComplianceSearch on Office 365 and delete the results.
playbook.name: Office 365 Search and Delete

playbook.description:
This playbook performs the following steps:
1. Creates a compliance search.
2. Starts a compliance search.
3. Waits for the compliance search to complete.
4. Gets the results of the compliance search as an output.
5. Gets the preview results, if specified.
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search

integrations.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Content Search (Deprecated)
O365 - Security And Compliance - Content Search v2

name: Microsoft Exchange Online
readme:
Exchange Web Services (EWS) provides the functionality to enable client applications to communicate with the Exchange server. EWS provides access to much of the same data that is made available through Microsoft Office Outlook.

## What does this pack do?

- Monitor a specific email account and create incidents from incoming emails to the defined folder.
- Search for an email message across mailboxes and folders.
- Get email attachment information.
- Delete email items from a mailbox.
- Manage Tenant Allow/Block Lists.

## Integrations
The [EWS O365 integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ewso365) enables you to:
- Retrieve information on emails and activities in a target mailbox.
- Perform operations on the target mailbox such as deleting emails and attachments or moving emails from folder to folder.

The [O365 - EWS - Extension integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ews-extension) enables you to manage and interact with Microsoft O365 - Exchange Online from within XSOAR
- Get junk rules for a specified mailbox.
- Set junk rules for a specified mailbox.
- Set junk rules for all managed accounts.
- Search message data.

The [EWS Extension Online Powershell v2 integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ews-extension-online-powershell-v2) enables you to retrieve information about mailboxes and users in your organization.
- Display client access settings that are configured on mailboxes.
- Display mailbox objects and attributes, populate property pages, or supply mailbox information to other tasks.
- Retrieve permissions on a mailbox.
- Display information about SendAs permissions that are configured for users.
- Display existing recipient objects in your organization such as mailboxes, mail users, mail contacts, and distribution groups.
- Add, remove, list, and count entries in Tenant Allow/Block Lists.

The [Security And Compliance V2](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/security-and-compliance-v2) enables you to:
- manage the security of all your organization's emails, SharePoint sites, OneDrives, etc.
- can perform actions (preview and delete) on emails.

## EWS Permissions
To perform actions on mailboxes of other users, and to execute searches on the Exchange server, you need specific permissions. 

| Permission |Use Case |
| ----- | ----|
| Delegate | One-to-one relationship between users. |
| Impersonation	| A single account needs to access multiple mailboxes. |
| eDiscovery | Search the Exchange server. |	
| Compliance Search | Perform searches across mailboxes and get an estimate of the results. |
